intro: Neea ignicola, commonly known as the fiery neea, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountain forests. Its foliage is evergreen, with lance-shaped leaves that have a slight waxy coating.
